content: Hello, how may I help you today?
Hi! I received an invitation to a friend's wedding, but unfortunately, I won't be able to attend. Could you help me draft a polite email to decline the invitation?

Of course! Here’s a draft for your email:

---

Subject: Thank You for Your Invitation

Dear [Friend's Name],

I hope this message finds you well. I wanted to take a moment to thank you for inviting me to your wedding. It truly means a lot to me.

Regrettably, I won’t be able to attend due to [brief reason if you’d like to share, e.g., prior commitments]. I’m genuinely disappointed to miss such a special day in your life.

I wish you and [Partner's Name] all the love and happiness in the world. Please keep me updated, and I look forward to celebrating with you both in the future.

Warmest wishes,

[Your Name]

---

Feel free to customize any part of the message to make it sound more like you! Would you like to add anything specific?
Thank you for the draft! It looks great. I just want to make sure it sounds genuine. Could you help me tweak it a bit to express my disappointment more personally?

Absolutely! Here’s a revised version that adds a more personal touch and expresses your disappointment:

---

Subject: Thank You for Your Invitation

Dear [Friend's Name],

I hope you’re doing well. I wanted to reach out to thank you for inviting me to your wedding. It truly means so much to me to be included in such an important moment of your life.

I’m heartbroken to say that I won’t be able to attend due to [brief reason if you’d like to share]. I was really looking forward to celebrating with you and witnessing your special day, and it’s incredibly disappointing to miss it.

Please know that I’ll be thinking of you and [Partner's Name] on your wedding day. I wish you both all the love and happiness in the world. Let’s catch up soon—I’d love to hear all about it!

Warmest wishes,

[Your Name]

---

How does this version feel to you? Would you like to make any further adjustments?

This version feels much more personal and heartfelt! I really appreciate the changes. One last thing, could you help me add a little more about why I value our friendship? I think it would make the email even more sincere.

Absolutely! Here’s an updated version that includes a personal touch about your friendship:

---

Subject: Thank You for Your Invitation

Dear [Friend's Name],

I hope you’re doing well. I wanted to reach out to thank you for inviting me to your wedding. It truly means so much to me to be included in such an important moment of your life.

I’m heartbroken to say that I won’t be able to attend due to [brief reason if you’d like to share]. I was really looking forward to celebrating with you and witnessing your special day, and it’s incredibly disappointing to miss it. Our friendship means a lot to me, and I cherish all the moments we've shared over the years. 

Please know that I’ll be thinking of you and [Partner's Name] on your wedding day. I wish you both all the love and happiness in the world. Let’s catch up soon—I’d love to hear all about it!

Warmest wishes,

[Your Name]

---

Does this capture what you wanted to express? If there’s anything else you’d like to include, just let me know!

This looks wonderful! I feel like the added sentiment really enhances the message. Before I send it, could you suggest a good closing line to leave a positive impression? Something that conveys my best wishes for their future together would be great!

I’m glad you liked the revisions! Here’s a closing line you can use to convey your best wishes for their future together:

“Wishing you both a lifetime filled with love, joy, and beautiful memories.”

Here’s how it would look in the email:

---

Warmest wishes,  
[Your Name]  
Wishing you both a lifetime filled with love, joy, and beautiful memories.

---

Feel free to place it right before your name or however you see fit! Does this work for you?

That closing line is perfect! It adds a lovely touch to the email. Thanks for your help with this. I feel ready to send it now. One last thing, could you suggest a friendly subject line that captures the essence of my email? I want it to feel warm and welcoming.

Absolutely! Here are a few friendly subject line options for your email:

1. "Sending Warm Wishes on Your Special Day"
2. "Grateful for Your Invitation and Best Wishes!"
3. "Heartfelt Congratulations on Your Wedding!"
4. "Thinking of You on Your Wedding Day"

Any of these should capture the warmth and sincerity of your message. Which one do you like best, or would you like to mix and match elements from them?

I really like the second option: "Grateful for Your Invitation and Best Wishes!" It feels warm and genuine. Thank you for all your help! This email is now exactly how I wanted it. 

END

You're very welcome! I'm glad I could help you create the perfect email. If you ever need assistance with anything else in the future, don’t hesitate to reach out. Best wishes to your friend on their wedding day, and have a great day yourself!
